children.subject: I was told by the EECS staff that the instructors decided against allowing webcasting, thus restricting capacity to the number of seats in Li Ka Shing.
That is true - if there is not webcasting then fire code prevents enrollment past the room capacity. Webcasting is at the discretion of faculty.
Is it not possible to find a new room / time for the class? :( With the new ds major creating more demand for 189, its an unfortunate semester to have this issue.
Why are there such few seats available for CS 189, which is an extremely popular class amongst non CS majors (stats, data science, math etc)
Did the drops already happen?
They have not - I thought I could get to them today but have had to deal with other enrollment issues. Unenrollment will happen tomorrow (Sunday) so look for changes then.
Could you let us know when the changes have happened? Thanks!
Also on CalCentral's Shopping List, I'm not able to select "waitlist if class is full" checkbox. Will this be available before tomorrow's adjustment period?
Have all the changes been made at this point (should I expect my WL position to change drastically again before adjustment period)?
There isn't an official textbook, but there are notes to read through which cover the majority of lectures.

+1 follow ups on @7410 suggests many potential solutions to the problems of there being not sufficient equipment. According to follow ups on that post the instructors decided to do this. I would like to know their reasoning.
would recommend emailing the professors as they are not on Piazza and the advisors were not given a reason

What is the reason for lack of webcasting? I feel like for such an important course being able to review the material at your own pace is very important.

Especially since there is no official textbook for the class...
oh well, what new about Berkeley?

Hi there,

This is a really good question, but I'm afraid that I think only the instructors can answer it. Maybe you could email them and share the answer back here with other students. 


Best wishes,

Nicole

For the wait listed students who have a chance of getting in to the class, how should we stay caught up with lectures and course material if we're not allowed to attend lectures so as to not violate the fire code?

history.content:
As mentioned in the post about CS 189 being over-enrolled (@7410), we will be un-enrolling some students and moving them to the waitlist for this class. This action will result in a waitlist that is much longer than can be accommodated into the class, even considering attrition. This class will not expand because there are no larger lecture halls available.
In an effort to set more realistic expectations about enrollment, we will be purging the waitlist so that only EECS and LSCS undergrad majors remain. 
We recognize this is unwelcome news, but by managing the wait list now, before the adjustment period opens on Monday (8/13), we hope to give people time to find other classes for which they may have priority seating. Affected students should have already received an email regarding this situation.
history.subject: F18: CS 189 WAITLIST Changes
